definition: ticket (for a bus or train)
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
train ticket

sentences.english: Firn is too big, the person that winds some is very sad without ticket.
sentences.chinese: 积雪太大，回有的的人没有车票好难过。

sentences.english: The train conductor punched my ticket.
sentences.chinese: 火车检票员在我的车票上轧洞。

sentences.english: Of course, I've booked the train tickets now. And Tom's looking forward to it.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，我已经订了火车票了，而且汤姆也很期待。

sentences.english: Next stop is Ping Shan. The end of Zone 4 for single-ride ticket.
sentences.chinese: 下一站系屏山，单程车票第四收费区终止。

sentences.english: Her wallet stolen, she had no money to buy even a bus ticket.
sentences.chinese: 因为钱包被偷了，她甚至连买车票的钱也没有了。

sentences.english: Next stop is Tin Wing, zone 4 for single-ride ticket.
sentences.chinese: 下一站系天荣，属单程车票第四收费区。

sentences.english: I take the train to go to work this morning and the conductor did not want to take my train ticket.
sentences.chinese: 今晨我程火车上班，车掌先生不要剪我的车票。

sentences.english: Jiang Kai countries after the surgery, bought a ticket to go home immediately.
sentences.chinese: 江开国在手术以后，自己买了车票要立即回家。

sentences.english: I got a second-class ticket on the train to New York.
sentences.chinese: 我弄到一张去纽约的二等舱火车票。

sentences.english: Could you get me two tickets for tomorrow here?
sentences.chinese: 你能否在这儿卖给我两张来日诰日的车票？

sentences.english: Next stop is Chestwood, zone 4 for single-ride ticket.
sentences.chinese: 下一站系翠湖，属单程车票第四收费区。

sentences.english: I got a second-class ticket on the train to Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我有张去巴黎的二等火车票。

sentences.english: We are booked through to New York.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经订好了去纽约的全程车票。

sentences.english: The ticket collector used a puncher to check the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 收票员用打洞器检查车票。

sentences.english: She followed him to the platform, standing back while he bought tickets.
sentences.chinese: 她跟着他到了月台，站在后面，而他在买车票。

sentences.english: They have booked two tickets through to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 他们订购了两张直达北京的车票。

definition: train ticket
to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
to book tickets/to issue tickets
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
air ticket/CL:張|张[zhang1]
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
air ticket/passenger ticket/CL:張|张[zhang1]
(railway) train
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
a bed (on a train)/a couchette
traveler/tourist
(increased) passenger transportation around Chinese New Year
